body.name: The Family Upstairs: A Novel
body.description: From the New York Times best-selling author and master of “bone-chilling suspense” (People) comes another pause-resisting look inside one family’s past as buried secrets threaten to come to light.Gifted musician Clemency Thompson is playing for tourists on the streets of Southern France when she receives an urgent text message. Her childhood friend, Lucy, is demanding her immediate return to London.It’s happening, says the message. The baby is back.Libby Jones was only six months old when she became an orphan. Now 25, she’s astounded to learn of an inheritance that will change her life. A gorgeous, dilapidated townhouse in one of London’s poshest neighborhoods has been held in a trust for her all these years. Now, it’s hers.As Libby investigates the story of her birth parents and the dark legacy of her new home, Clemency and Lucy are headed her way to uncover, and possibly protect, secrets of their own. What really happened in that rambling Chelsea mansion when they were children? And are they still at risk?Jewell’s novels have been praised as “sure to please fans of Ruth Ware and A.J. Finn” (Library Journal), and her latest is no exception. The Family Upstairs will keep you guessing until the very end. Read more

productInformation.name: Narrator
productInformation.value: Tamaryn Payne, Bea Holland, Dom Thornburn

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect suspense cocktail, with a twist or 5!
reviews.reviewText: If you’re reading this review, I hope your next move is to read the book, immediately, no disturbances or excuses, just go for it! I’m done reading it and I STILL don’t want to put it down. Dark, well written, addictive, twisty and turny suspense at its finest!Gooooooo! Loved it, won’t stop thinking of the characters (kids, not the baby) for awhile!Newest member of the Lisa Jewell fan club.Ps. Wow

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book took so many twists and turns, there were times I had to go back several chapters to find context. Each chapter is a different character's story and voice. Until the end when the story starts moving at top speed. Initially it was so confusing, I wasn't sure I wanted to complete it, but I am really glad I did! Just when you think you've figured out the full story...hang on...it just gets more complicated!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Twists … The Suspense …
reviews.reviewText: In The Family Upstairs, Jewell writes about a family that has everything you could hope for … beautiful kids, a gorgeous home, and wealth beyond what most people can comprehend. Then one day the matriarch of the family befriends a pop star and this family’s lives are soon turned upside down.This book was a slow burn, but I also could not put it down. How the characters’ storylines fit together, the mystery of what really happened, and what is in store for their futures made it one of the best books I’ve read in a while. Can’t wait to dive into the second book of this series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Interesting, but not a thriller, or a mystery or suspenseful. This entire book is the backstory to whatever comes next. I will wait a while before I decide whether I want to read that one, but as for this, I am mostly confused over how it got the labels it has.I would call it a family drama.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love Lisa Jewell
reviews.reviewText: I love Lisa Jewell novels, this one is no exception. To say The Family Upstairs is a strange, twisted tail, is an understatement. Start out with socialite family the Lambs, CEO father, PR agent mother ignore tween children sound s like a lot of other stories. But what happens when a quirky, bohemian, musician comes calling up roots everything and everyone. Good read, bit slow at some points, but I do recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Starts off slow, but it gets rolling and never stops. Very well written mystery, you don't feel like anything comes out of left field, it makes sense. And surprises! Got me a few times! Highly recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I loved this book!
reviews.reviewText: I couldn't put it down...great twist! start to finish I was wrapped up in this family. The lies, secrets and how people are so easily manipulated. Cannot wait to read the next one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Kept me Turning Pages
reviews.reviewText: This plot was rich and juicy. The last page still brought unexpected surprises. One of the best who-dun-its in a long time. Don't miss it!
Moves quickly, keeps you guessing, good characters. If you like other books by Lisa Jewell, this will not disappoint you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved the characters from the start and the story slowly unfolding kept me wanting to turn the page until it was done.
This book's story is veryyy amazing and very thrilling ...I read this book in just 1 day and the condition of the book was very good and I am satisfied with my purchase

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Just wow! I really enjoyed reading this book. I was a little bit confused at who was who at the beginning, but when i kept reading it al made sense. I never saw the twist coming. I am looking forward to read the second book ‘The family remains’
